body.p: All communications or remittances of money
should be addressed to WILLIAM H. WYCKOFF,
Corresponding Secretary, or C. A. BUCKBEE, As
Correspondents should be particular to write,
very legibly their names, Post-Office Address,
Periodicals, Minutes of Associations, or State
Conventions, or other records of public, religious
and benevolent institutions, in all parts of the
world, are especially desired to be addressed,
$30 makes a Life Member; $100 a Life Director.

At the late
meeting of our Board, it was unanimously agreed
to allow your claim for $75.00 for reading and cor-
recting proofs of three sets of Hebrew plates of Job.

Your letter on the subject does not
agree with the earlier letters in which the arrange-
ment was made. According to the latter, you would
really have no claim for more than $25.00. We sup-
pose that you have forgotten the exact forms of expression
employed in the earlier letters. But we took this view
of the matter. The time was longer than expected, the
trouble greater. The work was satisfactorily done, and
the compensation is not extravagant.

We enclosed to you a draft for
the balance due to you.

Has been thoroughly revised by the American Bible Union, and is now
ready for general circulation. It is published in a variety of forms, to
meet the tastes of all classes of readers.

QUARTO EDITION—Contains, 1. The Common English Version, the
Hebrew Text, and the Revised Version, with Critical and Philological
Notes. 2. The Revised Version, with Explanatory Notes for the English
Reader. 3. The Revised Version by itself. This is a very large quarto
Volume, printed on choice paper, and bound in muslin. It contains over
300 pages. Price, sent by Mail, $1 50.

OCTAVO EDITION—Contains the Revised Version in Paragraphs,
with Marginal Readings, for the English Reader. It contains 69 pages.
Price, sent by mail, in paper cover, 35c.; in muslin, 50c.

DUODECIMO EDITION—Is printed on a smaller page than the
Octavo Edition. It contains over 100 pages, and will be sent for the
same prices of the Octavo Edition. Paper cover, 35c.; muslin, 50c.

HEBREW AND ENGLISH—This edition is an 18mo. Volume. It
contains the Revised Version in Paragraphs, and the Original Hebrew
Text, with various Readings, on opposite pages. Over 200 pages. Sent by Mail, bound in muslin, 75c.

HEBREW—One Volume, 32mo. 146 pages. The Original Hebrew
Text, with various Readings, critically edited for the American Bible
Union Price, by Mail, bound in muslin, 50c.

body.p:
Uniform with the last Six Books of the New Testament, (already issued,)
containing the Second Epistle of Peter to Revelation, inclusive.

IT is sent forth, like all our preliminary revisions, for examination by friends,
and for criticism by scholars; not as a perfect work, but in the expectation that
its imperfections, whatever they may be, may be discovered and corrected.

It is a beautifully printed work, and can be sent with perfect safety, by mail, to
any part of the United States. PRICE 60 CENTS.

Booksellers and Agents, who may be disposed to aid in its circulation, will be
allowed the usual discount.

THIS work is published monthly, or oftener. Twelve numbers constitute a year's
subscription. It contains the Revised Scriptures, as rapidly as they can be prepared
for general circulation and criticism. The object of this publication is to enable all
who may desire to be kept constantly acquainted with the progress of the revision
enterprise. If every pastor and friend will interest himself in the circulation of
THE MONTHLY, it will materially advance the cause of faithful versions, and increase
the love of Bible reading in the Churches of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Specimen copies will be sent gratis, to any person making the request.
One Copy, for a Year, (or 12 numbers,) POSTAGE PREPAID,.............$1 00

THE QUARTERLY contains the transactions of the American Bible Union, at its
Annual Meetings, extracts from correspondence, and other Biblical intelligence.

Every Life Member and Life Director, and every subscriber for a Life Member or
Life Directorship, is entitled to receive, GRATIS, a copy of the Quarterly.
